meta.name: description
meta.content: Krum Independent School District serves K-12th grade students and is located in Krum, TX.

figcaption.p: 2nd Graders in Mrs. Dillon and Mrs. McDonald's class became published authors!
Author Lamar Giles visited KMS and signed student's copies of his novels!
2019 Annual Shamrock Shuffle Community Fun Run

img.figcaption: KHS Service Project enables every student at the Krum EEC to get a new book!

p.a: Local Businesses Team Up with Dyer Third Grade Safety Patrol to Make Toy Drive a Huge Success

figcaption.p: Krum FFA compiles donated goods to create Christmas Dinner Boxes for Krum Families in need.
FCCLA collects 374 pairs of socks to donate to the Monsignor King Outreach Center
Congratulations to the KHS Band for winning 1st Place in Class A at Bands of America Competition
The Krum Blue Brigade Debuts Marching Show

img.alt: Grading During Remote Learning: Policy Revisions Featured Photo

h3.a: Grading During Remote Learning: Policy Revisions

div.div: At a special called meeting of the Krum Independent School Board of Trustees last night, the board revised the temporary addendum to Policy EIC (LOCAL) as it pertains to grading during remote learning.

Applications for school supply assistance for eligible Krum ISD families through Apple Back to School Ministry are now available. Applications are due June 12th and may be accessed online by clicking the headline above.

img.alt: Krum ISD's Response and Action Pertaining to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) Featured Photo

h3.a: Krum ISD's Response and Action Pertaining to the Coronavirus (COVID-19)

img.alt: Krum ISD Extends Facility Closure Through May 3 Featured Photo

h3.a: Krum ISD Extends Facility Closure Through May 3

img.alt: Postponement of School Board Election Featured Photo

div.div: Krum ISD’s mission is to create a collaborative atmosphere with parents, students, and members of the community in order to ensure students will reach their full potential by providing every child with an exceptional education. We will strive to prepare our students academically and socially to embrace their future challenges, as well as ignite the desire to be lifelong learners by providing a safe, respectful, and positive learning environment.

div.p: Si necesita ayuda para traducir esta página web o su contenido al español, por favor contacte a Elizabeth Zepeda al 940-482-2685 o por correo electrónico a elizabeth.zepeda@krumisd.net.
